title.value: Machine-learning-based arc selection for constrained shortest path problems in column generation
title.justification: It is directly extracted from the title of the paper.
title.quote: Machine-learning-based arc selection for constrained shortest path problems in column generation

extractions.description: This paper proposes a new heuristic pricing algorithm based on machine learning to accelerate the pricing problem (PP) part of the column generation (CG) method used in constrained shortest path problems (CSPPs). By leveraging data from previous executions, the objective is to reduce the size of the network by retaining only arcs with a high chance of being part of the solution, thus improving computational efficiency. The approach is demonstrated on the vehicle and crew scheduling problem (VCSP) and the vehicle routing problem with time windows (VRPTW), showing significant computational time reductions.

type.justification: The paper presents the design and implementation of a new algorithm, followed by experimental results on benchmark problems.
type.quote: The remainder of the paper is organized as follows. Section 2 is devoted to some preliminaries and details about CG and the dynamic programming method used to solve the SPPRC. In Section 3, we describe the proposed selection strategy. Sections 4 and 5 will cover our two case studies, the VCSP and VRPTW respectively, highlighting the implementation differences between the two problems and reporting the computational results for each of them.

name.justification: The research is predominantly focused on optimization problems in operations research, specifically addressing vehicle and crew scheduling and vehicle routing with time windows using column generation techniques.
name.quote: Column generation has been successfully used to solve a variety of optimization problems, notably crew scheduling and vehicle routing problems arising in freight, urban and airline transportation.

name.justification: The paper introduces a machine-learning-based heuristic to improve the efficiency of solving constrained shortest path problems.
name.quote: Combining machine learning methods with operations research and combinatorial optimization algorithms (Bengio et al., 2020) has been the subject of many studies over the last few years.

name.justification: The primary optimization challenge tackled by the paper is the constrained shortest path problem (SPPRC and ESPPRC), addressed through a machine learning heuristic.
name.quote: The problems are mostly defined on a network, and the PP is usually an NP-hard shortest path problem with resource constraints.
